post_text:
September 8, 2020

District indoor facilities will not be available this fall to non-sanctioned school teams and activities. This includes all gym use for youth teams. We are keeping the schools closed to limit student interaction and activity outside the school day and provide our custodians the necessary time to clean and sanitize.

Gym usage will be reevaluated in December.

We realize the inconvenience for many of our youth teams, but we are implementing every possible measure to keep students in school without disruption caused by exposure to COVID.
text:
September 8, 2020

District indoor facilities will not be available this fall to non-sanctioned school teams and activities. This includes all gym use for youth teams. We are keeping the schools closed to limit student interaction and activity outside the school day and provide our custodians the necessary time to clean and sanitize.

Gym usage will be reevaluated in December.

We realize the inconvenience for many of our youth teams, but we are implementing every possible measure to keep students in school without disruption caused by exposure to COVID.

post_text:
Spartan Nation,

Tonight's Football Game will be livestreamed. Follow the action live!

https://www.solon.k12.ia.us/o/solon-csd/page/athletics-live-stream--2

To ensure the safety of our students, staff, community and spectators, we are limiting attendance to 50% of the stadium capacity for Tonight’s game against Williamsburg. Our decision was based on several factors, including the County’s positivity trajectory and collaboration with Johnson County Public Health.

Due to Covid-19
These are the only people that will be granted admission
-Families that have purchased activity passes
-People with tickets that were provided by the school

Go Spartans!

post_text: Return to Learn release timeline
shared_text:
SOLON.K12.IA.US
Return to Learn release timeline
text:
Return to Learn release timeline

SOLON.K12.IA.US
Return to Learn release timeline

post_text:
Timeline of release of the District Return to Learn Plan
• June 29th - completed the "assurances" with the Department of Education
• July 7th - District administration review
• July 9th - District Return to Learn team review (38 member team will participate in a Zoom to review the entire plan)
• July 15th - Plan will be sent to all district staff, along with an individual staff survey
• July 16th - Presented to the School Board
• July 20th - Released to the community (website, email, app), along with an individual parent survey
• July 22nd - Community wide webinar

Great job district team! And thank you for giving up your time in June. We have a very comprehensive plan for all 3 scenarios 1) onsite learning, 2) hybrid learning, and 3) online home learning. Our plan will provide students and staff a safe and quality education, regardless of the scenario.
text:
Timeline of release of the District Return to Learn Plan
• June 29th - completed the "assurances" with the Department of Education
• July 7th - District administration review
• July 9th - District Return to Learn team review (38 member team will participate in a Zoom to review the entire plan)
• July 15th - Plan will be sent to all district staff, along with an individual staff survey
• July 16th - Presented to the School Board
• July 20th - Released to the community (website, email, app), along with an individual parent survey
• July 22nd - Community wide webinar

Great job district team! And thank you for giving up your time in June. We have a very comprehensive plan for all 3 scenarios 1) onsite learning, 2) hybrid learning, and 3) online home learning. Our plan will provide students and staff a safe and quality education, regardless of the scenario.

post_text:
Johnson County Homeland Security has scheduled a briefing today at 3PM to provide status and/or updates in response to the COVID-19 virus. The briefing will be followed by a Press Conference hosted by Dave Kock, Director of Public Health at 4:30.I will be attending the briefing and will provide you with any new information related to Solon.
Solon CSD staff and students are doing a great job implementing all preventative measures recommended by the Department of Public Health. We will continue to follow the lead and guidance of the Department of Public Health.
text:
Johnson County Homeland Security has scheduled a briefing today at 3PM to provide status and/or updates in response to the COVID-19 virus. The briefing will be followed by a Press Conference hosted by Dave Kock, Director of Public Health at 4:30.I will be attending the briefing and will provide you with any new information related to Solon.
Solon CSD staff and students are doing a great job implementing all preventative measures recommended by the Department of Public Health. We will continue to follow the lead and guidance of the Department of Public Health.

post_text: There has NOT been any student or staff member that has tested positive or displayed symptoms of the virus. We continue to communicate and take direction from the Johnson County and Iowa Department of Public Health. We are out front as any organization can possibly be. We have already been doing everything preventative that is recommended by the IDPH as we have been disinfecting schools weekly and in many areas, daily. As we receive more information, we will communicate.
text: There has NOT been any student or staff member that has tested positive or displayed symptoms of the virus. post_text:
When in schools today, I was asked by several about the cold front coming later today and possible impact on school tomorrow. The National Weather Service has issued a windchill Advisory, which predicts the "real-feel" could drop to -25 degrees. In the past we've delayed or cancelled school for Windchill Warnings, but never for Advisories. A Warning is issued when temperatures fall below -30 degrees.

The National Weather Service is NOT predicting temps to fall below -30 degrees so I anticipate our schedule will run normal tomorrow. There is a risk of slick roads and limited visibility in the morning, depending on the amount of snow we receive tonight so we will monitor that closely. In the case of a delay, we will not release early. Based on the National Weather Service, it appears we will be able to run a normal schedule tomorrow.

For immediate updates, download the district app, (Solon CSD) and turn on the Notifications.

In the past we've delayed or cancelled school for Windchill Warnings, but never for Advisories. A Warning is issued when temperatures fall below -30 degrees.

The National Weather Service is NOT predicting temps to fall below -30 degrees so I anticipate our schedule will run normal tomorrow. There is a risk of slick roads and limited visibility in the morning, depending on the amount of snow we receive tonight so we will monitor that closely. In the case of a delay, we will not release early. Based on the National Weather Service, it appears we will be able to run a normal schedule tomorrow.
